Description: Typical range for Nd:YAG lasers in stone cleaning to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100W for light contamination on Onyx (chalcedony-based, low thermal conductivity); max safe below 500W to prevent cracking (based on IPG Photonics specs and studies in J. Cult. Herit. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Onyx absorption and minimal subsurface damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
